radiographic_examinations.findings: Normal echocardiography during initial presentation and no significant fibrosis or myocyte disarray on histological examination.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Echocardiography has been normal during a follow-up of 10 years.

radiographic_examinations.findings: The ECG demonstrated unusually slow atrial flutter that was conducted 1:1 to the ventricles along with prolonged QRS duration, sinus node dysfunction, high-degree atrioventricular block, and a normal QT interval post-ablation.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Prolongation of P-wave duration, PR interval, and QRS duration was progressive with age in mice with the DN allele, observed at both 3 and 12 weeks.
